artist: Karl-Arne Breger; Telefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson, Stockholm, Sweden
creditline: Lent by Richard and Diana Rose
description: orange; one-piece unit; rectangular base with ear piece extending up from it; mouth piece in base; thin, black rubber band around bottom of base; similar in shape to .1-.8 but with more geometric with defined edges; underside is black with push buttons with white numbers; red, horizontal hang-up switch above key pad and 2 small rectangles below key pad on either side of slot for home number
text: Commemorating Ericsson's centenary anniversary, an adaptation of the earlier "Ericofon" was introduced in 1976, produced in push-button only and given a more sharply defined silhouette.  The colors were likewise intensified reflecting the times.  The model 700 never captured the public's favor enjoyed by the earlier curvaceous model.  Only 30,000 models were manufactured through 1984.
title: "Ericofon Centenary" model 700 push-button telephone
